<a name="Submitting_Test_Requests" id="Submitting_Test_Requests"></a><h1> <span class="mw-headline"> Submitting Test Requests </span></h1> 
<p>You can submit tests to pagetest either by doing a POST or a GET to <a href="http://www.webpagetest.org/runtest.php" class="external free" title="http://www.webpagetest.org/runtest.php" rel="nofollow">http://www.webpagetest.org/runtest.php</a> 
</p><p>In response you will either get redirected to the results page or you will get an xml response (depending on if xml was requested).
</p> 
<a name="Parameters" id="Parameters"></a><h2> <span class="mw-headline"> Parameters </span></h2> 
<table border="1" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="5"> 
Parameters
<tr> 
<th> Parameter </th><th> Required </th><th> Description </th><th> Default
</th></tr> 
<tr> 
<td> url </td><td> required </td><td> URL to be tested </td><td> 
</td></tr> 
<tr> 
<td> location </td><td> optional </td><td> Location to test from </td><td> Dulles 1.5Mb DSL
</td></tr> 
<tr> 
<td> runs </td><td> optional </td><td> Number of test runs (1-20) </td><td> 1
</td></tr> 
<tr> 
<td> fvonly </td><td> optional </td><td> Set to 1 to skip the Repeat View test </td><td> 0
</td></tr> 
<tr> 
<td> domelement </td><td> optional </td><td> DOM Element to record for sub-measurement </td><td> 
</td></tr> 
<tr> 
<td> private </td><td> optional </td><td> Set to 1 to keep the test hidden from the test log </td><td> 0
</td></tr> 
<tr> 
<td> connections </td><td> optional </td><td> Override the number of concurrent connections IE uses (0 to not override) </td><td> 0
</td></tr> 
<tr> 
<td> web10 </td><td> optional </td><td> Set to 1 to force the test to stop at Document Complete (onLoad) </td><td> 0
</td></tr> 
<tr> 
<td> script </td><td> optional </td><td> Scripted test to execute </td><td> 
</td></tr> 
<tr> 
<td> block </td><td> optional </td><td> space-delimited list of urls to block (substring match) </td><td> 
</td></tr> 
<tr> 
<td> login </td><td> optional </td><td> User name to use for authenticated tests </td><td> 
</td></tr> 
<tr> 
<td> password </td><td> optional </td><td> Password to use for authenticated tests </td><td> 
</td></tr> 
<tr> 
<td> authType </td><td> optional </td><td> Type of authentication to use: 0 = Basic Auth, 1 = SNS </td><td> 0
</td></tr> 
<tr> 
<td> video </td><td> optional </td><td> Set to 1 to capture video </td><td> 0
</td></tr> 
<tr> 
<td> f </td><td> optional </td><td> Format.  Set to "xml" to request an XML response instead of a redirect ("json" is also provisionally supported) </td><td> 
</td></tr> 
<tr> 
<td> r </td><td> optional </td><td> When using the xml interface, will echo back in the response </td><td> 
</td></tr> 
<tr> 
<td> notify </td><td> optional </td><td> e-mail address to notify with the test results </td><td> 
</td></tr> 
<tr> 
<td> callback </td><td> optional </td><td> URL to ping when the test is complete (the test ID will be passed as an "id" parameter) </td><td> 
</td></tr> 
<tr> 
<td> bwDown </td><td> optional </td><td> Download bandwidth in Kbps (used when specifying a custom connectivity profile) </td><td> 
</td></tr> 
<tr> 
<td> bwUp </td><td> optional </td><td> Upload bandwidth in Kbps (used when specifying a custom connectivity profile) </td><td> 
</td></tr> 
<tr> 
<td> latency </td><td> optional </td><td> First-hop Round Trip Time in ms (used when specifying a custom connectivity profile) </td><td> 
</td></tr> 
<tr> 
<td> plr </td><td> optional </td><td> Packet loss rate - percent of packets to drop (used when specifying a custom connectivity profile) </td><td> 
</td></tr> 
<tr> 
<td> k </td><td> optional </td><td> API Key (if assigned) - applies only to runtest.php calls.  Contact the site owner for a key if required (pmeenan@webpagetest.org for the public instance) </td><td> 
</td></tr></table> 
<a name="Specifying_Connectivity" id="Specifying_Connectivity"></a><h2> <span class="mw-headline"> Specifying Connectivity </span></h2> 
<p>If the connectivity is not specified, by default you will get the DSL (1.5Mbps/ 384Kbps) profile.  The connectivity is specified as part of the location in the format:
</p><p><b>location.connectivity</b> 
</p><p><br /> 
For example:
</p><p><b>Dulles_IE7.DSL</b> 
</p><p><b>Frankfurt.Dial</b> 
</p><p><b>China.custom</b> 
</p><p><br /> 
The supported profiles for the public instance are:
</p> 
<ul><li> <b>DSL</b> - 1.5 Mbps down, 384 Kbps up, 50 ms first-hop RTT, 0% packet loss
</li><li> <b>FIOS</b> - 20 Mbps down, 5 Mbps up, 4 ms first-hop RTT, 0% packet loss (not all locations will get the full bandwidth)
</li><li> <b>Dial</b> - 49 Kbps down, 30 Kbps up, 120 ms first-hop RTT, 0% packet loss
</li><li> <b>custom</b> - Custom profile, bandwidth and latency must also be specified using the bwIn, bwOut, latency and plr parameters
</li></ul> 
<a name="XML_Response" id="XML_Response"></a><h2> <span class="mw-headline"> XML Response </span></h2> 
<p>The XML response follows the format of REST API's.  You will get a HTTP 200 response to the request itself indicating that the request was parsed but the result of the submission itself will be in the XML.  See the samples for a full example XML response.
</p> 
<pre> 
<response>
    <statusCode></statusCode>
    <statusText></statusText>
    <requestId></requestId>
    <data>
        <testId></testId>
        <xmlUrl></xmlUrl>
        <userUrl></userUrl>
        <summaryCSV></summaryCSV>
        <detailCSV></detailCSV>
    </data>
</response>
</pre> 
<p><b>statusCode</b> - 200 indicates a successful submission.  Anything else is an error (and will come back as 400 with descriptive text)
</p><p><b>statusText</b> - Descriptive error text explaining the failure
</p><p><b>requestId</b> - Request ID echoed from request (r parameter).  Will not be present if not specified.  Makes it easier to track asynchronous requests.
</p><p><b>testId</b> - ID assigned to the test request (and used in all of the urls)
</p><p><b>xmlUrl</b> - URL to use to get the results in XML format
</p><p><b>userUrl</b> - URL to use to direct the user to a results page (what you would normally get redirected to if not using the XML interface)
</p><p><b>summaryCSV</b> - URL to the summary results in CSV format (page-level data and timings).  Will return a 404 if the test is not yet complete.
</p><p><b>detailCSV</b> - URL to the full detail results in CSV format (request-level data and timings).  Will return a 404 if the test is not yet complete.
</p> 
<a name="Samples" id="Samples"></a><h2> <span class="mw-headline"> Samples </span></h2> 
<p>Test www.aol.com and redirect to the results page:
</p> 
<pre> 
http://www.webpagetest.org/runtest.php?url=www.aol.com
</pre> 
<p><br /> 
Test www.aol.com 10 times, first view only and redirect to the results page:
</p> 
<pre> 
http://www.webpagetest.org/runtest.php?url=www.aol.com&amp;runs=10&amp;fvonly=1
</pre> 
<p><br /> 
Test www.aol.com 2 times and get the response as xml with the request ID "12345" embedded in the response:
</p> 
<pre> 
http://www.webpagetest.org/runtest.php?url=www.aol.com&amp;runs=2&amp;f=xml&amp;r=12345
 
&lt;response&gt;
	&lt;statusCode&gt;200&lt;/statusCode&gt;
	&lt;statusText&gt;Ok&lt;/statusText&gt;
	&lt;requestId&gt;12345&lt;/requestId&gt;
	&lt;data&gt;
		&lt;testId&gt;091111_2XFH&lt;/testId&gt;
		&lt;xmlUrl&gt;http://www.webpagetest.org/xmlResult/091111_2XFH/&lt;/xmlUrl&gt;
		&lt;userUrl&gt;http://www.webpagetest.org/result/091111_2XFH/&lt;/userUrl&gt;
	&lt;/data&gt;
&lt;/response&gt;
</pre> 
<a name="Getting_Test_Results" id="Getting_Test_Results"></a><h1> <span class="mw-headline"> Getting Test Results </span></h1> 
<p>under normal use (non-xml) you will be redirected to the results page.  When using the XML API you should use the xmlUrl provided in the response to the test request.  The XML url can also take an optional r= parameter to include a requestId in the response.
</p><p>The format of the response for the test details is the same as for submitting the request (with different data).  All times are in ms.
</p> 
<pre> 
&lt;response&gt;
	&lt;statusCode&gt;&lt;/statusCode&gt;
	&lt;statusText&gt;&lt;/statusText&gt;
	&lt;requestId&gt;&lt;/requestId&gt;
	&lt;data&gt;
		&lt;runs&gt;&lt;/runs&gt;
		&lt;average&gt;
			&lt;firstView&gt;
			&lt;/firstView&gt;
			&lt;repeatView&gt;
			&lt;/repeatView&gt;
		&lt;/average&gt;
		&lt;run&gt;
			&lt;id&gt;&lt;/id&gt;
			&lt;firstView&gt;
				&lt;results&gt;
				&lt;/results&gt;
				&lt;pages&gt;
				&lt;/pages&gt;
				&lt;thumbnails&gt;
				&lt;/thumbnails&gt;
				&lt;images&gt;
				&lt;/images&gt;
				&lt;rawData&gt;
				&lt;/rawData&gt;
			&lt;/firstView&gt;
			&lt;repeatView&gt;
				&lt;results&gt;
				&lt;/results&gt;
				&lt;pages&gt;
				&lt;/pages&gt;
				&lt;thumbnails&gt;
				&lt;/thumbnails&gt;
				&lt;images&gt;
				&lt;/images&gt;
				&lt;rawData&gt;
				&lt;/rawData&gt;
			&lt;/repeatView&gt;
		&lt;/run&gt;
		&lt;run&gt;
		...
		&lt;/run&gt;
	&lt;/data&gt;
&lt;/response&gt;
</pre> 
<p><b>statusCode</b> - 200 if the test is complete and results are available.  100 if the test is still pending (try again in a reasonable amount of time - 5-10 seconds).  400 if it is an invalid test ID.
</p><p><b>statusText</b> - Descriptive text of any failures
</p><p><b>requestId</b> - Request ID echoed from the request
</p><p><b>runs</b> - Number of runs in the response
</p><p><b>average</b> - Averaged test results across all of the successful runs (a block each for first and repeat view data)
</p><p><b>run</b> - A block for each test run with the results for that run
</p><p><b>id</b> - Run number (increments up from 1 in order)
</p><p><b>firstView/repeatView</b> - A block of results each for First and Repeat view data
</p><p><b>results</b> - Test results (all times are in ms)
</p><p><b>pages</b> - URL's to user pages
</p><p><b>thumbnails</b> - URL's to the thumbnails for the various images (waterfall, checklist, screen shot)
</p><p><b>images</b> - URL's to the full-sized images (waterfall, checklist, screen shot)
</p><p><b>rawData</b> - URL's to the headers and tab-delimited results files
</p><p><br /> 
</p>

<a name="Location_Information" id="Location_Information"></a><h1> <span class="mw-headline"> Location Information </span></h1> 
<p>You can request a list of locations as well as the number of pending tests for each using the getLocations.php interface:
</p> 
<pre>
